channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: O/s Coop 188a Halfway Street' - Planters, 24th July
item.description:
You have informed us that the problem is "Resolved / Fixed" ….Nothing at all has been done to improve these planters - still white marks on one of them, full of weeds, some bits of rubbish and a broken tree branch on the pavement nearby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Valliers Wood Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to bollard, sign and tree, 24th July
item.description:
Last night 23rd of July a car careened off the road over the central reservation into the tree and bollard and sign and hit another car. They reversed off and drove away. I reported this to the police and the owner of the car was also informed. But there is a lot of material that needs to be removed and replaced and repaired and you may want to attempt to contact the owner of the car to recover damages. But it may have been a stolen car

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Palace Court, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass is STILL on footbridge, 24th July
item.description:
I reported this yesterday, case no 7922257. It was then reported as “fixed “ . I’ve just walked over the footbridge and the glass is still there . It’s the same glass as yesterday. Yet again I’ve had to carry my dog over the glass. Can you make sure that it’s actually cleaned up before closing the case.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A variety of overgrown bushes and trees at the front of my property and overhanging into my garden, 24th July
item.description:
As stated in the summary, I am having an increased level of bushes and trees at the front entrence of my property and also around the back, garden area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheveney Walk, Shortlands, London

item.title: Barriers left on pavement after Pride event, 24th July
item.description:
These barriers were reported as blocking the pavement in Upper James Street after the Pride event on July 5th. They were not removed but just moved further down the road where they continue to block the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Upper James Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grey plastic sheeting on pavement and in road, 24th July
item.description:
My third time of reporting this! Despite two emails saying the problem has been fixed, some of the sheeting is still there! It is on Lancell Street, where it has been for some weeks. Some now just under the wheels of a car. Rest on pavement.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lancell Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
